website_summaries.verdict: This chocolate advent calendar set actually features 2 separate 24 window scenes.
pros: Includes 2 packs of imported German chocolate
Individual pieces feature a wide variety of Christmas-themed characters
Children can color image on back of calendar
cons: Some pieces may fall out of windows or migrate

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my grandchildren, thinking it would be fun to help them count down the days until Christmas. Unfortunately when they open them some of the chocolates have slipped around into other slots and some days have no chocolate, some two or more! Not very much fun. I have not tasted the chocolate but according to them it’s not very good either. I won’t waste my money on these again.
customer_reviews.author: S Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and price
customer_reviews.text: I have two girls and I really appreciate the two pack option. My girls look forward to opening their door everyday. It has also been a good test to see if my 2 year old knows her numbers. These calendars were also reasonable priced. Definitely recommend these advent calendars!

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We have received these same calendars for over 20+ years. I was thrilled to find them on Amazon when the little German store we would buy them at closed last year. Unfortunately, the calendars were dented and creased in the corners. The first door we opened, the chocolate was gross looking (see pics)! We ended up throwing some of the candies in the garbage. I was willing to pay more for the calendars just for the nostalgia factor but unfortunately I was disappointed with the overall quality for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ladybug

product_meta.title: Two Pack - Chocolate Advent Calenders 1.76 oz
product_meta.description: 2 pack of advent calendars with each December day's window containing a piece of chocolate and a special double door for Christmas Eve (December 24th). A fun way to countdown to Christmas with a daily chocolate treat. The advent has been celebrated since the 4th century AD. Originally, it began at the end of the feast of Saint Andrew and lasted until Christmas. Today, the advent is celebrated starting on December 1st and lasts until Christmas Eve. The tradition of calendars can be traced to the German Protestants. During the advent they would mark the days with chalk or lit calendars. While popular in many European countries, advent calendars were not popular in the United States until a photo was released showing President Dwight D. Eisenhower opening the doors of a calendar with his grandchildren. PeA is happy to be a part of the Christmas season and tradition for many families. As the #1 selling imported advent calendar in the United States, PeA has proved time and time again to bring merriment. Each door features a different piece of molded chocolate that’s sure to inspire yuletide cheer!. This 2-pack features one santa and one snowman design, each calendar contains 24 doors, with a piece of milk chocolate behind each. Make it one of your holiday traditions.
feature_bullets: Two pack of advent calendars - 2 different designs, each day contains a piece of chocolate behind a window corresponding to December's date before Christmas Day
Each day's chocolate piece has a different textured shape: santa, stocking, elf, tree, star, snowman, reindeer, gift, sleigh, angel, teddy etc
One santa and one snowman pictoral design in each 2-pack, with each calendar containing 24 textured milk chocolates
#1 selling imported advent calendar. Imported from Germany
The back of the calendar has a seasonal picture for kids to color in
